Types

FormatOption {...}{.size: 4.} = enum
  CRAM_OPT_DECODE_MD, CRAM_OPT_PREFIX, CRAM_OPT_VERBOSITY, ## obsolete use hts_set_log_level() instead
  CRAM_OPT_SEQS_PER_SLICE, CRAM_OPT_SLICES_PER_CONTAINER, CRAM_OPT_RANGE, CRAM_OPT_VERSION, ## rename to cram_version?
  CRAM_OPT_EMBED_REF, CRAM_OPT_IGNORE_MD5, CRAM_OPT_REFERENCE, ## make general
  CRAM_OPT_MULTI_SEQ_PER_SLICE, CRAM_OPT_NO_REF, CRAM_OPT_USE_BZIP2,
  CRAM_OPT_SHARED_REF, CRAM_OPT_NTHREADS, ## deprecated use HTS_OPT_NTHREADS
  CRAM_OPT_THREAD_POOL,       ## make general
  CRAM_OPT_USE_LZMA, CRAM_OPT_USE_RANS, CRAM_OPT_REQUIRED_FIELDS,
  CRAM_OPT_LOSSY_NAMES, CRAM_OPT_BASES_PER_SLICE, ## General purpose
  HTS_OPT_COMPRESSION_LEVEL = 100, HTS_OPT_NTHREADS, HTS_OPT_THREAD_POOL,
  HTS_OPT_CACHE_SIZE, HTS_OPT_BLOCK_SIZE
CRAM specific 
SamField {...}{.size: 4.} = enum
  SAM_QNAME = 0x00000001, SAM_FLAG = 0x00000002, SAM_RNAME = 0x00000004,
  SAM_POS = 0x00000008, SAM_MAPQ = 0x00000010, SAM_CIGAR = 0x00000020,
  SAM_RNEXT = 0x00000040, SAM_PNEXT = 0x00000080, SAM_TLEN = 0x00000100,
  SAM_SEQ = 0x00000200, SAM_QUAL = 0x00000400, SAM_AUX = 0x00000800,
  SAM_RGAUX = 0x00001000
Flag = distinct uint16
CPtr[T] = ptr CArray[T]
SafeCPtr[T] = object
  size: int
  mem: CPtr[T]

Cigar = ref object
  cig: SafeCPtr[uint32]
  n: uint32
Cigar represents ths SAM Cigar type. It consists of one or more CigarElement s. 
CigarElement = distinct uint32
CigarElement encodes the operation (length and type) of each element of a Cigar. 
Consume = distinct uint32
CigarOp {...}{.pure.} = enum
  match, insert, deletion, ref_skip, soft_clip, hard_clip, pad, equal, diff, back
Range = tuple[start: int, stop: int]
Header = ref object of RootObj
  hdr*: ptr bam_hdr_t
Header wraps the bam header info. 
Record = ref object of RootObj
  b*: ptr bam1_t
  hdr: Header
Record is a single alignment object. 
Bam = ref object of RootObj
  hts*: ptr htsFile
  hdr*: Header
  rec: Record
  idx*: ptr hts_idx_t
Bam wraps a BAM/CRAM/SAM reader object from htslib. 
Target = ref object
  name*: string
  length*: uint32
  tid*: int
Target is a chromosome or contig from the bam header. 
IndexStats = tuple[mapped: uint64, unmapped: uint64]
BamError = ref object of ValueError
Splitter = ref object
  aln*: Record
  chrom*: string
  start*: int
  cigar*: string
  qual*: uint8
  NM*: uint16
A splitter represents one item from an SA tag

proc open(bam: var Bam; path: cstring; threads: int = 0; mode: string = "r";
         fai: cstring = nil; index: bool = false): bool {...}{.discardable,
    raises: [IOError, ValueError], tags: [WriteIOEffect].}
open_hts returns a bam object for the given path. If CRAM, then fai must be given. if index is true, then it will attempt to open an index file for regional queries. 
proc hts_set_opt(fp: ptr htsFile; opt: FormatOption): cint {...}{.varargs, cdecl,
    importc: "hts_set_opt", dynlib: libname.}

    tags: [WriteIOEffect].}

    tags: [WriteIOEffect].}
proc delete_tag(r: Record; itag: string): bool {...}{.inline, raises: [], tags: [].}
remove the tag from the record return a bool indicating success. 
proc tag[T: int | float | string | char | cstring](r: Record; itag: string): Option[T]
Get the aux tag from the record. Due to nim language limitations, this must be used as, e.g.: tag[int](rec, "NM"). It will return none if the tag does not exist or if it is not of the requested type. This can be a shorter alternative to rec.aux() which requires first checking if the value is nil and then getting the return type. 
proc stop(s: Splitter): int {...}{.inline, raises: [OverflowError, ValueError], tags: [].}
calculate the stop value for the splitter 
proc `$`(s: Splitter): string {...}{.raises: [ValueError, OverflowError], tags: [].}

iterator querys(bam: Bam; region: string): Record {...}{.
    deprecated: "hts/bam: use query for string queries", raises: [IOError],
    tags: [WriteIOEffect].}
query iterates over the given region. A single element is used and overwritten on each iteration so use Record.copy to retain.
